title: Simone Biles Hasn’t Competed in More Than a Year. She’s Not Alone.
sub_head: The Covid-19 pandemic has changed everything about training for an Olympics. Many top athletes have struggled to train properly, much less compete.
body:
On her way to becoming the greatest gymnast of all time, Simone Biles began each year by writing out her goals: short-term, medium-term and long-term. Her training to meet them drew heavily on the competition calendar, which gave her very specific deadlines and clear windows when she could take a break.
As she prepares to step into the Ariake Gymnastics Centre in Tokyo at the Olympic Games this summer, Biles is contending with something totally unfamiliar. The most-decorated female gymnast in world championship history has not competed since October 2019.
Coronavirus has not just delayed the arrival of a second Olympics that Biles expects to be her last. It’s also wiped from the buildup any certainty around the smaller events that have normally served as important stepping stones.
It’s possible that Biles this year will go from a few domestic meets straight to the biggest stage of the sport, giving an international debut of a record-shattering vault and a fresh floor routine at the place least conducive to trying something different.
“You don’t really want to go to the Olympic Games and perform a brand new skill for the first time,” said Biles’s coach, Cecile Landi, who is still hoping that an international event will take place before the Games that can serve as a dress rehearsal for Biles.
